list_page_teaser: The image of Frank Sobotka's personality is very warm and quite different from the frequently cool portraits of the many mostly logical characters on The Wire.  Click to learn more!
description_html:
Along with Clay Davis, Frank Sobotka is one of the most emotional characters on The Wire, and the image of his personality on this page reflects this warmth. When it comes to doing business, he and his nephew Nick — who is also decisive but much more logical and cool — make a good team.

The image of Frank's son Ziggy's personality shows he is very open to new experiences, which helps explain how he often comes off as a goof-ball. In contrast, the image of Vondas' personality is coldly logical, pragmatic, and withdrawn — all business.

image_list.title: Frank Sobotka
image_list.gallery_page_teaser: The Red in Frank's spiritual portrait shows he is much more emotional than logical, and the Yellow shows he is pragmatic.  Click on the image to learn more!
image_list.explain_dom: The Red in this spiritual portrait represents Frank's dominant personality trait, Feeling: passion; amiability; friendliness; compassion; warmth; very slight/moderate/strong preference for emotion/empathy/subjectivity over logic/reason/objectivity; their very slight/moderate/strong preference for the emotional/personal/subjective over the logical/rational/objective.

The Red in Frank's spiritual portrait represents their dominant personality trait, their very slight/moderate/strong preference for making emotional/personal/objective rather than logical/rational/objective decisions; their very slight/moderate/strong preference for being emotional/personal/subjective rather than logical/impersonal/objective.
image_list.explain_dom_constant: In Extraverts, the dominant trait is directed outwardly, and spiritual portraits use a long vertical line to represent this, because it is the side of their personality that is most evident.  He/She demonstrates/exhibits this trait in their (note that is easier to find examples of decisions than perceptions!) ....
image_list.explain_aux: The Yellow in this spiritual portrait represents Frank's auxiliary personality trait, Sensing: pragmatism; pragmatic; practical; realism; realistic; outlook; openness to experiences; very slight/moderate/strong preference for facts over ideas.

The Yellow in Frank's spiritual portrait represents their auxiliary personality trait, their very slight/moderate/strong preference for seeing the world more in terms of facts than of ideas; need for sensual stimulation.
image_list.explain_aux_constant: In Extraverts, the auxiliary trait is directed inwardly, and spiritual portraits use a horizontal line to represent this.  He/She demonstrates/exhibits this trait in their (note that is easier to find examples of decisions than perceptions!) ....
image_list.story_html_img: Idea: only include images with stories for family and friends.
